name: Ben Den
review: This mouse is very light weight. It's very comfortable because of light weight

name: Christina
review: It feels well-built overall and has a comfortable, right-handed shape suitable for all grip types and most hand sizes.

name: Edward
review: Right-handed gaming mouse with two buttons on the left and a range of modular pieces we can swap out to change the look and feel of the mouse.

name: Foto Sushi
review: It's great for gaming thanks to its low click latency and customizable CPI and polling rate.

name: Harps
review: It feels fairly well-built with its honeycomb design, and it's extremely light. But the sensor undershoots a fair amount when moving at a fast speed.

name: Jonas
review: It has extremely low click latency, a high maximum polling rate, and we can reprogram most of its buttons.
